name: SetGithubActionsPermissions
description:
Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise.

Set the permissions policy for GitHub Actions within an enterprise. Requires admin authentication with the `admin:enterprise` scope.

parameters.name: enterprise_identifier
parameters.description: The slug or ID of the enterprise for setting GitHub Actions permissions.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: enabled_organizations_policy
parameters.description: Specifies which organizations can run GitHub Actions: 'all', 'none', or 'selected'.

value_schema.description: The policy that controls the organizations in the enterprise that are allowed to run GitHub Actions.

parameters.name: actions_permission_policy
parameters.description: Specifies the actions allowed to run in the enterprise. Possible values: 'all', 'local_only', 'selected'.

value_schema.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions that are allowed to run.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.
